intro: Eriogonum monticola, commonly known as the mountain buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, showy pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. It has small, narrow leaves and produces numerous seeds in its fruiting structures. Eriogonum monticola is adapted to harsh environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for wildlife.
